author: Nirnimesh Kumar
text:
A Delhi court on Saturday remanded Pearls Group chairman-cum-managing director Nirmal Singh Bhangoo in CBI custody for 10 days in a case relating to alleged swindling of Rs. 45,000 crore from more than five crore investors from different States.

Metropolitan Magistrate Harvinder Singh remanded Mr. Bhangoo till January 19, allowing the investigating agency’s argument for his custodial interrogation to unravel the alleged conspiracy and find the money trail.

The court remanded Sukhdev Singh, managing director and promoter-director of Pearls Agrotech Corporation Ltd., Gurmeet Singh, executive director (finance) and Subrata Bhattacharya, executive director in Pearls Golden Forest Ltd. and Pearls Agrotech Corporation Ltd., in CBI custody.

Counsel for Bhangoo, Vijay Aggarwal, opposed the CBI plea for custody, submitting that investigation in the case had been going on for the past two years, and now nothing was left for questioning him.
title: Pearls Group chairman in CBI custody
